content: grateful blanket crochet pattern by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful https //www ravelry com/designers/susan-e-kennedy @prettypeacefulcrochet on instagram pretty peaceful on facebook pretty peaceful youtube video tutorials crochet this easy beginner blanket as a gift for someone you re grateful for for a new baby or as a gift to yourself or your family the simple double_crochet stich is perfect to show off a gradient or ombré yarn baby/kids blanket adult throw blanket 36 by 44 91 by 112 cm 46 by 70 117 by 179 cm shown across a king size bed you can make your blanket any size you like to make a wider blanket add any number of stitches you want to the first row repeat row 2 until your blanket is long enough for you youtube video tutorial find the tutorial video for this blanket on my pretty peaceful crochet channel on youtube https //youtu be/m1h5gl4hm0w share your project with #gratefulblanket on instagram tag @prettypeacefulcrochet too because i love to see your blankets please feel free to sell finished items made from this pattern credit the design as grateful blanket crochet pattern by pretty peaceful not for commercial use please do not share photos of this pattern pdf instead please share your projects and the pattern link on youtube ravelry or etsy thank you for your support yarn bulky weight category 5 962 yards 880 m for a baby/kids blanket or 1 924 yards 1 760 m for an adult throw blanket any yarn will work for this blanket use the hook size recommended on the yarn label the sample blankets used caron colorama halo o go yarn a 71% acrylic 18% nylon 11% polyester yarn with 481 yards 440 m per 227-gram skein the baby/kids blanket used 2 skeins in lavender frost the adult throw blanket used 4 skeins in nutmeg frost some similar yarns are caron colorama caron latte cakes ice yarns softair tweed red heart roll with it premier yarns puzzle hobbii fantasy loops & threads impressions lion brand ice cream roving bernat pop red heart with love scheepjes river washed xl and red heart brushed soft skill level beginner hook size 6 mm us j gauge 11 5 double_crochet stitches and 7 row = 4 inches 10 cm terms us chain yarn over and pull through loop on hook double_crochet double_crochet yarn over insert hook into stitch yarn over pull through stitch and two loops yarn over and pull through both loops on hook fdc foundation double_crochet optional a method for creating the first row without having to make a separate row of chains first i prefer this option because it s an easier way for me to get started it makes the blanket look smoother and more even because chains can be awkward to crochet into see http //www mooglyblog com/foundation-double-crochet-fdc/ for a video tutorial csdc chainless starting double_crochet optional a method for beginning each row without having to chain this method helps to keep your edges straight and makes it easier
